Description: Rectangular fragment of a polychrome tomb-painting representing Ahmose-Nefertari standing among foliage with cartouche above.
Curator's comments: PM I Part 1: p. 231. The tomb is now largely destroyed; this register is shown intact in a drawing of Robert Hay (BL Addmss 29822 f. 117): the tomb-owner offers to Amenhotep I, Ahmose Nefertari (in a shrine), and a clothed Djed-pillar. To be published by Bacs and Parkinson
